website_summaries.verdict: A well-made French press by a premium manufacturer that works well and delivers delicious flavor.
pros: This French press is decorative as well as functional with its enamel finish, which is available in several colors
cons: A few customers found the plunger unreliable

customer_reviews.title: Le Creuset in China???? Oh No!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little pot is cute and it does keep the coffee warmer than my glass French press. But, it really does feel cheaply made and is not at all worth the price. I think we are paying for the Le Creuset name but sadly, this item was definitely not made in France. I am keeping it but think I overpaid.
customer_reviews.author: NY chic

customer_reviews.title: Le Creuset makes great products, and this one had been on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Le Creuset makes great products, and this one had been on my list for quite some time. I decided to get it for my mother as a Christmas present and we are both enjoying the benefits of hot coffee and beautiful craftsmanship every morning. The handle is especially nice because it feels you're just holding a large mug. Our first one arrived chipped but the replacement arrived the next day. What great service. I look forward to many years of great conversations over coffee from this french press.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Not functional.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely press but the mesh does not fit properly. My coffee needs to be strained otherwise I am drinking grounds. I may have to use it as a flowerpot.
customer_reviews.author: JANET C GIVEN

customer_reviews.title: Could Not Be Happier
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a Bodum, I replaced it with this Le Creuset, very glad I did. This is the first Le Creuset product I have owned. Excellent product, the press is very easy to disassemble and clean - unlike a Bodum, and, it is very easy to clean overall. Further, it is extremely durable. Could not be happier. Keep up the good work Le Creuset!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Phillips

customer_reviews.title: easy to store
customer_reviews.text: I have returned to the pour over method (Chemex when I want more than a couple cups) and French Press when I want 1-2 cups). So simple, easy to store, and this one holds heat better than glass.
customer_reviews.author: rew

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: My search for the perfect cup is over! Just amazing. I am making my kitchen healthier and removing all plastics and non stick coatings etc and my old coffee pot had a plastic filter holder and tank. This just amazing. It’s beautiful. Made a pot of coffee with a perfect crema on top. Pour in just to cover the grounds to let the coffee bloom for a minute. Then fill wait and press. Worth every penny. So so happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Annette L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: .....it's Le Creuset, it's clean, it's white and it makes my morning coffee ritual all the more pleasurable.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: French press go-to.
customer_reviews.text: A great French press. Sturdy. Sleek. The filter press mechanism works VERY well. I was nervous about how well the inner walls would handle the metal mesh but everything about this is great. It’s also strong enough to have taken the few accidental smacks against the inside of my kitchen sink, and there isn’t a single mark to show for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ceramic french coffee brewer!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, looks nice on the counter. Dropped and didn't even chip! Rinse-out clean.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Leaves grounds in our coffee cup
customer_reviews.text: I love Le Cruset products! Big fan. I’m a bit disappointed that every time, no matter how well or coarse we grind our coffee, there’s always grounds in our cup. We make sure to not fill the press too much with water. That seems to help. Other then that, it’s asthestically pleasing to the eye and it cleans well and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Quynh Bee

customer_reviews.title: Durable and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: I adore this French press. Between my children and myself, we've broken quite a few glass French presses over the years. This has stood up to daily use. Plus, it's lovely on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product. Exactly what I expected. Coffee tastes better than ever. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen W

customer_reviews.title: Love the product and the result
customer_reviews.text: My second pot! One for the studio, one for our family! Love the product and the result!
customer_reviews.author: Lise

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful to look at - not functional
customer_reviews.text: I love Le Creuset. This French Press is beautiful to look at however not functional. The gap between the wall of the container and the press doesn't seal correctly therefore eliminating the 'press' functionality which results in weak coffee. Again - beautiful to look at - however that is it.
customer_reviews.author: ShayF

customer_reviews.title: Just what you'd expect.
customer_reviews.text: Just what you would expect from Le Creuset. Top drawer.
customer_reviews.author: John Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this French press. I purchased the white, the interior is beige. I bought to use on the weekends. We use the keureg during the week but I wanted some variety with coffee. I only have a few personal recommendations from actual use and no gripes yet... - pour water to base of spout, haven't had any grounds in drink - it's an experiment to get the results of your preference. I steep my coffee for 15 minutes. - very easy to clean. I hand wash and air dry
customer_reviews.author: PenName

customer_reviews.title: a beautiful disappointment
customer_reviews.text: a beautiful disappointment because the press is elegant and attractive, however, the filters are not big enough and the grounds slip by creating a weak Turkish coffee every time. I bought different coffees and ground from coarse to medium. There was nothing I could do but spoon out the unfiltered coffee particles floating in my cup. I had no problems receiving credit for this poor choice.
customer_reviews.author: Hoss Gomez

customer_reviews.title: The plunger didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one I found in Williams Sonoma which I loved. Unfortunately the plunger is either to small (the netting, I think) or the jug is slightly larger in diameter. The coffee when plunged would shoot out of the spout and when poured would be thick with grounds. Debating on whether to return or just use my old plunger. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bookpreneur

customer_reviews.title: Le Crueset Love
customer_reviews.text: Makes delicious coffee. Exquisite quality. Thank you. I am glad I ignored the negative reviews. Make sure you are using a coarse grind for the people who do not know how to use a French Press. A long life to all.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Mercè Clay

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty and sturdy, but the functional design is lacking. It doesn’t hold heat for long at all, and you have to push the strainer down verrrry slowly or it splashes back up an makes a huge mess. I wouldn’t recommend this product for the price it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Really nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty much in love with this coffee pot. It looks so nice in my kitchen. It's perfect for my needs. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Debra R. La Joie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful mother's day present and great coffee press
customer_reviews.text: Arrived ahead of shipping date. Thank you. Wonderful mother's day present and great coffee press.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality item!
customer_reviews.text: My wife had to have this item, talked about it for weeks. We’ve only used it once in the past year, but I admit it looks pretty sweet sitting on the kitchen counter. I use our leaf blower to dust it off every couple months. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves Le Creuset
customer_reviews.text: Makes a nice cup of coffee, expensive on the front end but will last years!
customer_reviews.author: Kwolf

customer_reviews.title: I love the Le Creuset brand of kitchen ware
customer_reviews.text: I love the Le Creuset brand of kitchen ware. I’m never disappointed in the quality. I love this product and enjoy a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful french press
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and function of the french press. The only reason it is not a five-star rating is that the coffee doesn't stay as hot as I'd like it to.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: I love all things LeCreuset so I decided to try their French press. It is amazing and makes wonderful coffee. It's perfect. I'm so glad I went with my gut and added this to our home. It is easy to use and makes great coffee once YOU learn the art of making French pressed coffee. This pot makes about four cups which is two large cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Pour Spout Defect Leads to Perpetual Dripping
customer_reviews.text: For a fairly expensive french press, I am disappointed by the design of the pour spout. It looks like the end of the spout is not tapered sharply enough, which results in coffee dripping down the side of the press every time. This becomes quite annoying over time, especially if you tend to place your press on surfaces that you'd like to protect (porous surfaces such as marble, quartz, or high quality wood tables). I never had this problem with Bodem french presses. I was tired of glass french presses cracking so I took a leap of faith and purchased a Creuset press at a much higher price. That was a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. So

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, but That's It.
customer_reviews.text: This french press, like most Le Crueset pieces looks great and can really bring a kitchen together with other Le Creuset items. BUT, this is not a good french press. The top doesnt fit snuggly on the body and moves freely, while you try to filter the liquid. This causes the plunger to be uneven all the way down, which results in coffee grounds and particles to move passed the filter. I tried to mitigate this by also using a paper coffee filter on the plunger, but it doesnt fix the real problem. And the coffee is essentially ruined. Now I have a $70 piece on my counter taking up space, while I use a $30 french press from Target.
customer_reviews.author: R Stack

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY....My husband bought for a birthday gift so I can't leave a "verified purchase" review....
customer_reviews.text: This thing spews hot liquid and coffee grounds EVERYWHERE! No matter how long it sits. Once you press down it's exploding everywhere. I've ruined countless dishtowels, shirts, had to scrub down my backsplash every time, wipe down the entire kitchen counter....stick with a Mr. Coffee press if you want normalcy!
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: My son loved this gift!
customer_reviews.text: My son has used French presses before & he has discerning taste for good coffee. If he loves it, I feel confident in recommending it to other coffee lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M. Polando
